paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the effects of chlorpheniramine on hERG channels, specifically mentioning mutations in the KCNH2 gene (Y652A and F656A) that affect drug binding. No clinical or penetrance data for these variants are provided.

functional_data.summary: The Y652A mutation partially attenuated the hERG current block by chlorpheniramine.
assays: Two-microelectrode voltage-clamp techniques in Xenopus oocytes

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
key_quotes: The S6 domain mutations Y652A and F656A partially attenuated (Y652A) or abolished (F656A) the hERG current block.

functional_data.summary: The F656A mutation abolished the hERG current block by chlorpheniramine.
assays: Two-microelectrode voltage-clamp techniques in Xenopus oocytes

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
key_quotes: The S6 domain mutations Y652A and F656A partially attenuated (Y652A) or abolished (F656A) the hERG current block.

challenges: No clinical or penetrance data available for the variants.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper focuses on functional studies of KCNH2 variants Y652A and F656A without providing clinical or penetrance data.
